intro: Pamphilia styracifolia, commonly known as the sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy on the underside. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with four petals and a prominent central stamen. Pamphilia styracifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
